newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - June 4.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - June 4.

text.p: -- The General Accounting Office is expected to testify that rival U.S. airlines should be allowed to fly at least 23 daily round trips into Britain's Heathrow airport, if a proposed alliance between British Airways Plc and American Airlines is to win U.S. approval. American is a unit of AMR Corp, which closed at 97-5/8 Tuesday.

-- Integrated Systems Inc said it expected to report first quarter earnings of between $0.01 and $0.03 per share, compared to a First Call consensus estimate of $0.06 per share. It also said it would consolidate marketing, sales and support operations in anticipation of a series of product launches over the rest of the year. Its stock closed at 13-15/15 on Nasdaq, then fell to 10 in after-hours trading.
-- FNB Corp said it agreed to acquire Home Savings Bank of Siler City for $15.50 per share in stock and cash. FNB closed at 29-1/2 while Home Savings closed at 12-1/2.
-- Seagate Technology Inc, whose shares fell on Monday after it made a profit warning, said its board approved the repurchase of another $600 million shares of common stock. Seagate closed at 38-5/8.
-- General Motors Corp reported an 8.1 percent drop in May U.S. vehicle sales, with car sales faring worse than expected and truck sales rising to an all-time record. General Motors closed at 56-7/8.
